t: Psalm 51
A Prayer of Repentance
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David when Nathan the prophet went to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba.
Have*pn mercy upon me, O God, According*ld to Your lovingkindness; According*ld to the multitude of Your tender mercies, Blot*ld out my transgressions.
Wash*ld me thoroughly from my iniquity, And*ld cleanse me from my sin.
For*ln I acknowledge my transgressions, And*ld my sin is*i always before me.
Against*ld You, You only, have I sinned, And*ld done this*i evil in Your sight— That*ld You may be found just when You speak, And*ild blameless when You judge.
Behold,*ln I was brought forth in iniquity, And*ld in sin my mother conceived me.
Behold,*ld You desire truth in the inward parts, And*ld in the hidden part*i You will make me to know wisdom.
Purge*ln me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; Wash*ld me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
Make*ld me hear joy and gladness, That*ild the bones You have broken may rejoice.
Hide*ld Your face from my sins, And*ld blot out all my iniquities.
Create*ln in me a clean heart, O God, And*ld renew a steadfast spirit within me.
Do*ld not cast me away from Your presence, And*ld do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
Restore*ln to me the joy of Your salvation, And*ld uphold me by*i Your*i generous Spirit.
Then*ild I will teach transgressors Your ways, And*ld sinners shall be converted to You.
Deliver*ln me from the guilt of bloodshed, O God, The*ld God of my salvation, And*ild my tongue shall sing aloud of Your righteousness.
O*ld Lord, open my lips, And*ld my mouth shall show forth Your praise.
For*ld You do not desire sacrifice, or else I would give it;*i You*ld do not delight in burnt offering.
The*ld sacrifices of God are*i a broken spirit, A*ld broken and a contrite heart— These,*ld O God, You will not despise.
Do*ln good in Your good pleasure to Zion; Build*ld the walls of Jerusalem.
Then*ld You shall be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, With*ld burnt offering and whole burnt offering; Then*ld they shall offer bulls on Your altar.
